intro: Pedicularis groenlandica var. surrecta, commonly known as the Greenland betony, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
